meanings.definition: Coolths (noun): The quality of being cool or cold.
meanings.sent1: The coolths of the ice cream made it refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: I love the coolths of winter mornings when everything is covered in frost.
meanings.sent3: The penguin strutted proudly, showing off its coolths to the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor exuded coolths, making everyone around her feel at ease.
meanings.sent5: The coolths of the mountain air was invigorating as we reached the summit.

meanings.definition: Coolths (adjective): Cool or cold in temperature.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped herself in a coolths blanket to escape the summer heat.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream was a coolths treat on a hot afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The coolths breeze rustled the leaves, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent4: His icy stare sent a chill down her spine, his gaze coolths and piercing.
meanings.sent5: The coolths water from the mountain stream was a welcome relief after the long hike.
